meta.name: EFL Individual Client Profile Definitions
meta.codexReference: §4.4 Population Architecture; Sport Demands Grid v2.0; Load Standards v2.2.0; EFL_Periodization_FV_Schema_v2_1; EFL_Governance_v4_1; EFL_Coach_AI_Playbook_v0_5_0
meta.owner: Austin Lawrence, Director of Performance Systems
notes: Z-style FV zone identifiers are canonical (e.g., Z3 not Zone_3).
Sprint ceilings reference TRUE sprints only (≥90% Vmax) unless explicitly overridden by a higher authority document.
Load ceilings in this file are aligned to Load Standards v2.2.0 Table 3.2 (Youth 13-17 Hard Caps) and Governance v4.1.
All ICPs include reference to detailed individual ICP documents for full specifications.
F-V bias assessment protocols vary by population maturity and season per Governance v4.1 Gates 1-2.

ICP_HS_BASKETBALL_OFFSEASON.description: High school basketball athlete (ages 14-18) in off-season development phase. Eligible for specialization blocks with proper prerequisites. F-V bias aware with legal bias determination per population/season.

load_standard_profile.rationale: Load Standards v2.2.0 Youth 13-17 hard ceilings enforced across ALL programming. Ceilings apply regardless of F-V bias selection.

fv_bias_profile.bias_assessment_protocol: CMJ height + RSI (30cm drop), Squat 1RM vs BW ratio per Load Standards v2.2.0 Section 4.1 Diagnostics. Assessment date required in EPA input.

bias_override_rules.rule_1: If IN_SEASON or POST_SEASON detected, EPA automatically overrides to BALANCED per Governance v4.1 Gate 2, regardless of athlete history
bias_override_rules.rule_2: Youth 16 & under: BALANCED only (all seasons) per Load Standards v2.2.0 Table 5.2 Population Rules
bias_override_rules.rule_3: Youth 17 advanced: VELOCITY_BIASED/FORCE_BIASED allowed OFF/PRE seasons only; BALANCED forced IN/POST per Governance v4.1 Gate 1

fv_bias_profile.notes: HS basketball off-season; FORCE_BIASED only allowed for documented advanced Youth 17 per Governance v4.1 and must be BALANCED in-season. This ICP applies exclusively to OFF_SEASON athletes.

ICP_YOUTH_FOUNDATION.description: Youth athlete (ages 8-12) in foundational development phase. Focus on movement patterns, coordination, and fun-based learning.

load_standard_profile.rationale: Load Standards v2.2.0 Youth 8-12 hard ceilings. Young tissue requires conservative plyometric and sprint exposure.

fv_bias_profile.bias_assessment_protocol: Movement screen + basic unloaded jump test (no load diagnostics). Per Load Standards v2.2.0.
fv_bias_profile.notes: Youth 8–12 must remain BALANCED; FORCE_BIASED and VELOCITY_BIASED profiles are forbidden per Governance v4.1 Gate 1 and Load Standards v2.2.0 Table 5.2.

ICP_R2P_STAGE_2_ACL.description: Athlete in Stage 2 of ACL Return to Play protocol. Focus on strength restoration, pain-free movement, and controlled progression to Stage 3.

load_standard_profile.rationale: R2P athletes operate under strict conservative ceilings per Governance v4.1. No reactive shock work (E3) allowed in any R2P stage.

fv_bias_profile.bias_assessment_protocol: Clinical testing, joint status review, and controlled strength symmetry checks per R2P protocol.
fv_bias_profile.notes: All R2P stages must remain BALANCED; performance F-V biases (FORCE/VELOCITY) are not legal until full discharge per Governance v4.1 Gate 1.

ICP_ADULT_GENPOP.description: General population adult focused on durability, health, and functional strength. May include performance adaptations if not in-season.

load_standard_profile.rationale: Adult GenPop operates at lower intensity and volume than performance athletes. Conservative plyometric exposure with emphasis on durability.

fv_bias_profile.bias_assessment_protocol: CMJ profile + submax strength test or movement assessment per Coach & AI Playbook v0.5.0.
fv_bias_profile.notes: Adults may hold any legal bias in off-season, but in-season/post-season contexts must enforce BALANCED per Governance v4.1 Gate 2.

ICP_VOLLEYBALL_INSEASON.description: In-season volleyball athlete (any age). Focus on maintenance and performance optimization during competition season.

load_standard_profile.rationale: In-season athletes operate at lower intensity than off-season to avoid overtraining with competition load. Sprint exposure limited to match demands only.

fv_bias_profile.bias_assessment_protocol: CMJ profile + match and practice jump count review per Playbook v0.5.0.
fv_bias_profile.notes: In-season athletes must remain BALANCED per Governance v4.1 Gate 2; FORCE_BIASED and VELOCITY_BIASED profiles are forbidden in-season per Load Standards v2.2.0.

changes_from_v2_3_0: Fixed HS Basketball load ceilings to match Load Standards v2.2.0 Table 3.2 (120/240/600)
Added reference_detailed_icp field to all ICPs for traceability to full specification documents
Clarified node_access (current legal nodes) vs e_node_ceiling (highest expressible E-tier)
Added tier_3_max_percent to all load_standard_profile blocks for explicit safety specification
Expanded fv_bias_profile.notes with specific governance rules and season restrictions
Updated codexReference to include Load Standards v2.2.0, Periodization v2.1, Governance v4.1, Playbook v0.5.0
Added load_ceiling_source hint pointing to Load Standards v2.2.0 Table 3.2
Aligned all bias rules to Governance v4.1 Gates 1-2 with explicit season overrides

v2_3_0.rationale: Initial F-V bias integration without HS Basketball specialization block alignment

integration_notes.usage: This definitions file serves as the canonical reference for all ICP selections in EFL systems. Each ICP entry references a detailed document for full specifications, load profiles, specialization block eligibility, assessments, and EPA integration rules.
integration_notes.for_coaches: Use the reference_detailed_icp field to access the full ICP specification document. Example: ICP_HS_BASKETBALL_OFFSEASON selects EFL_ICP_HS_BASKETBALL_OFFSEASON_v2_3_1.json for complete load standards, block eligibility, assessment battery, and periodization templates.
integration_notes.for_epa: EPA v2.2.1 and later validate load ceilings and F-V bias legality against these definitions. All athlete load and bias inputs must conform to the selected ICP's constraints.
integration_notes.for_system: This file is LOCKED to prevent accidental modifications. New ICPs or versions require formal review process per Governance v4.1.
integration_notes.next_review: 2026-03-23 or upon Load Standards v2.2.1 release
